原文: quantified selbri: convert 7 to ordinal selbri; x_1 is seventh among x_2 ordered by rule x_3.

機能語: delimited non-Lojban selbri-unit
原文: delimited non-Lojban selbri-unit
語法: Similar to {me'oi} but requires delimiters, to allow quotation of multiple words or words with glottal-stops. In other words, {me'oi}:{mu'oi} :: {zo'oi}:{zoi} :: {la'oi}:{la'o} . Equivalent to {me'au} {la'e} {zoi}.

機能語: elliptical/unspecified truth value; "maybe, maybe not"
原文: elliptical/unspecified truth value; "maybe, maybe not"
語法: {cau'i}, but in NA. Indicates unspecificity or uncertainty between {ja'a} and {na}. See {cau'e}.

機能語: 命題肯定 ： 主に selbri の左に付いて命題全体を肯定する
原文: bridi logical affirmer; scope is an entire bridi.
語法: ・読み方： ジャハ

機能語: 命題否定 ： 文中で右に続く語すべてをその命題に関して否定する； 特定の語を否定するのは na'e
原文: bridi contradictory negator; scope is an entire bridi; logically negates in some cmavo compounds.
語法: ・大意： 命題否定 ・読み方： ナ

機能語: elliptical bridi logical negator/affirmer/truth-evaluation
原文: elliptical bridi logical negator/affirmer/truth-evaluation
語法: See also: {cau'o'e}

機能語: weak bridi affirmation; barely; almost not at all.
原文: weak bridi affirmation; barely; almost not at all.

機能語: weak bridi negation; almost, but not quite.
原文: weak bridi negation; almost, but not quite.

機能語: strong scalar intensifier: extremely...
原文: strong scalar intensifier: extremely...
語法: {rei'e}:{ru'e}:{milxe} ; {noi'e}:{na'oi}:{cnano} ; {sai'e}:{sai}:{mutce} ; {cai'e}:{cai}:{tcetce}. See http://mw.lojban.org/papri/zipcpi:_scalar_modifiers

機能語: elliptical/unspecified scalar modifier: "maybe, maybe not", modifies next selbri-unit or tag
原文: elliptical/unspecified scalar modifier: "maybe, maybe not", modifies next selbri-unit or tag
語法: {cau'i}, but in NAhE. Shortened from {cau'o'e}. See {cau'a}.

機能語: elliptical/vague/indecisive scalar affirmer/negator; true neutral/non-committed/uninvolved scalar truthfulness/assertion
原文: elliptical/vague/indecisive scalar affirmer/negator; true neutral/non-committed/uninvolved scalar truthfulness/assertion
語法: Useful for when the truthfulness or falseness of a bridi is undesirable (the speaker makes no firm stance or assumption on the matter). Different from {no'e} in that it does not necessarily select a neutral value on a scale; it merely acknowledges that some value on the scale could be chosen/that the scale exists, but does not choose one (it is hands-off). If one does not want to accuse someone of being or doing something, but wants to talk about it, this word would be used; often can be used for "are or are not".

機能語: 段階肯定 ： 段階詞； 段階否定にたいして肯定を上書きする
原文: scalar affirmer; denies scalar negation: Indeed!.
語法: 「実に」 ・読み方： ジェハ

機能語: NAhE question.
原文: NAhE question.

機能語: 段階否定（～以外の／～ではなく） ： 段階詞；
原文: contrary scalar negator: other than ...; not ...; a scale or set is implied.
語法: ・大意： 段階： 非 ・読み方： ナヘ

機能語: Contradictory negation of a predicate
原文: Contradictory negation of a predicate
語法: The quantifier negation laws can be stated as: naku ro da zo'u da broda .ijo [su'o] da zo'u da na'ei broda, naku [su'o] da zo'u da broda .ijo ro da zo'u da na'ei broda.

機能語: 段階中間 ： 段階詞； je'a と to'e の中間
原文: midpoint scalar negator: neutral point between je'a and to'e; "not really".
語法: ・大意： 段階： 中間 ・読み方： ノヘ ・関連語： {nutli}, {midju}, {milxe}; {je'a}, {na'e}, {to'e}

機能語: scalar normative: normal in intensity
原文: scalar normative: normal in intensity
語法: {rei'e}:{ru'e}:{milxe} ; {noi'e}:{na'oi}:{cnano} ; {sai'e}:{sai}:{mutce} ; {cai'e}:{cai}:{tcetce}. See http://mw.lojban.org/papri/zipcpi:_scalar_modifiers

機能語: scalar question: how very...?
原文: scalar question: how very...?
語法: Asks for NAhE. See http://mw.lojban.org/papri/zipcpi:_scalar_modifiers . See {pei'a}. Note: As many of the NAhE in this system are new and may be unfamiliar, NAI/CAI may be substituted for the answer instead.

機能語: scalar abator: slightly... / not very...
原文: scalar abator: slightly... / not very...
語法: {rei'e}:{ru'e}:{milxe} ; {noi'e}:{na'oi}:{cnano} ; {sai'e}:{sai}:{mutce} ; {cai'e}:{cai}:{tcetce}. See http://mw.lojban.org/papri/zipcpi:_scalar_modifiers

機能語: scalar intensifier: very...
原文: scalar intensifier: very...
語法: {rei'e}:{ru'e}:{milxe} ; {noi'e}:{na'oi}:{cnano} ; {sai'e}:{sai}:{mutce} ; {cai'e}:{cai}:{tcetce}. See http://mw.lojban.org/papri/zipcpi:_scalar_modifiers

機能語: 段階反対 ： 段階詞； je'a の反対； 対義語を造る
原文: polar opposite scalar negator.
語法: ・大意： 段階： 反対 ・読み方： トヘ ・関連語： {dukti}, {natfe}, {na'e}, {no'e}, {je'a}

機能語: negation sumti qualifier: that which indeed is.
原文: negation sumti qualifier: that which indeed is.
語法: Cf. {je'a}, {bo}, {na'ebo}, {no'ebo}, {to'ebo}.

機能語: negation sumti qualifier: something other than.
原文: negation sumti qualifier: something other than.
語法: Cf. {na'e}, {bo}, {je'abo}, {no'ebo}, {to'ebo}.

機能語: negation sumti qualifier: the neutral form/value of.
原文: negation sumti qualifier: the neutral form/value of.
語法: Cf. {no'e}, {bo}, {na'ebo}, {je'abo}, {to'ebo}. Midpoint between {je'abo} and {to'ebo}.

機能語: negation sumti qualifier: the opposite of.
原文: negation sumti qualifier: the opposite of.
語法: Cf. {to'e}, {bo}, {na'ebo}, {no'ebo}, {je'abo}.

機能語: selbri → 演算子 ： selbri をMEX（数式）演算子に変換する； cmavo として用意されていない演算子を捻出するのに用いる
原文: convert selbri to mex operator; used to create less-used operators using fu'ivla, lujvo, etc.
語法: ・読み方： ナフ

機能語: affirm last word: attached to cmavo to affirm them; denies negation by nai whenever it is applicable.
原文: affirm last word: attached to cmavo to affirm them; denies negation by nai whenever it is applicable.
語法: Suggested by Mark Shoulson in 1999 as an affirmative of {nai}. By analogy with the pairs {na}/{ja'a}, {na'e}/{je'a}, and {na'i}/{jo'a}.

機能語: 小構造否定 ： 左の語を否定する。命題否定か、対義否定か、段階否定かは、左の語の selma'o によって異なる。
原文: attached to cmavo to negate them; various negation-related meanings.
語法: TAhE, ROI, ZAhO 以外の間制や、法制や、論理接続や、 NU に付くと、矛盾否定 {na} と同じ意味になる。 TAhE, ROI, ZAhO や、非論理接続 JOI, BIhI に付くと、段階否定 {na'e} と同じ意味になる。 UI, CAI, COI に付くと、対義否定 {to'e} と同じ意味になる。 ・読み方： ナイ

機能語: (adverbial) bridi logical affirmer; "it is true that...."; affirms the bridi as well as any other adverbial or quantifier located on its right.
原文: (adverbial) bridi logical affirmer; "it is true that...."; affirms the bridi as well as any other adverbial or quantifier located on its right.
語法: See also {naku}.

機能語: (adverbial) bridi contradictory negator; "it is not true that...."; negates the bridi as well as any other adverbial or quantifier located on its right.
原文: (adverbial) bridi contradictory negator; "it is not true that...."; negates the bridi as well as any other adverbial or quantifier located on its right.

機能語: selbri → オペランド ： selbri をMEX（数式）オペランドに変換する；
原文: convert selbri to mex operand; used to create new non-numerical quantifiers; e.g. "herd" of oxen.
語法: ・読み方： ニヘ

機能語: discursive: paragraph break; introduce new topic.
原文: discursive: paragraph break; introduce new topic.

機能語: discursive: paragraph break; resume previous topic.
原文: discursive: paragraph break; resume previous topic.

機能語: Selbri incidental relative clause; attaches to a selbri with the ke'a being 'me'ei the attached selbri'
原文: Selbri incidental relative clause; attaches to a selbri with the ke'a being 'me'ei the attached selbri'
語法: Cf. {me'ei}, {me'au}, {noi}, {po'oi}.

機能語: selbri restrictive relative clause; attaches to a selbri with the ke'a being "me'ei the attached-selbri"
原文: selbri restrictive relative clause; attaches to a selbri with the ke'a being "me'ei the attached-selbri"
語法: Cf. {me'ei}, {me'au}, {no'oi}, {poi}.

機能語: 関連 bridi ： 関係詞（非制限）； 左の sumti に関連する bridi を結びつける
原文: non-restrictive relative clause; attaches subordinate bridi with incidental information.
語法: 「pu viska lo nu ro da noi spesi'u jo'u verba jo'u gerku cu lacpu lo carce gi'e klave'u kei .u'i／夫婦で、子供と犬とみんないつしよに車をひつぱつて行商してゐるのを見た、おもしろいなあ。」（山頭火『行乞記』） ・読み方： ノイ

機能語: 関連 bridi （制限） ： 関係詞（制限）； 左の sumti に関連する bridi を結びつける
原文: restrictive relative clause; attaches subordinate bridi with identifying information to a sumti.
語法: 「.u'u lo litru pe lo nu voksa poi mutce simsa tu'a lo patfu cu se badri／父によう似た声が出てくる旅はかなしい」（山頭火『行乞記（二）』） ・読み方： ポイ

機能語: 叙述 bridi ： 関係詞（非制限）； 左の sumti を主観的に叙述する bridi を結びつける； この bridi が真に sumti に当てはまるとは限らない
原文: non-veridical restrictive clause used to form complicated le-like descriptions using "ke'a".
語法: ・読み方： ヴォイ

機能語: titular relative clause: gives a title/name in the form of a relative clause, e.g. "Alexander the Great" or "Woobie, Destroyer of Worlds"
原文: titular relative clause: gives a title/name in the form of a relative clause, e.g. "Alexander the Great" or "Woobie, Destroyer of Worlds"
語法: See comments for dialectal/proposal-related notes. For a bare title without a name or a descriptor, use {la} {poi'i}. Also see {voi'e}

機能語: PA incidental relative clause; attaches to a PA number/numeral/digit with the ke'a referring to that PA number/numeral/digit.
原文: PA incidental relative clause; attaches to a PA number/numeral/digit with the ke'a referring to that PA number/numeral/digit.
語法: It attaches to the last mentioned PA, which can be only a single digit within a number rather than the entire number itself (if it has digit length greater than one in some base). Thus, beware of grouping. Confer: {poi'a}, {jau'au}. The attachment of this word to the immediately preceding word can be ovverriden by the usage of {xe'au}, which begins bracketing together an utterance/subexpression that will be considered to be the single and whole referent of the clause introduced by this word, wthe utterance of which also finishes the bracket. There is a proposal to expand the attachment of this word to any word spoken in a mekso utterance (rather than only members of selma'o PA), including members of selma'o VUhU, etc.

機能語: PA restrictive relative clause; attaches to a PA number/numeral/digit with the ke'a referring to that PA number/numeral/digit.
原文: PA restrictive relative clause; attaches to a PA number/numeral/digit with the ke'a referring to that PA number/numeral/digit.
語法: It attaches to the last mentioned PA, which can be only a single digit within a number rather than the entire number itself (if it has digit length greater than one in some base). Thus, beware of grouping. Confer: {noi'a}, {jau'au}. The attachment of this word to the immediately preceding word can be ovverriden by the usage of {xe'au}, which begins bracketing together an utterance/subexpression that will be considered to be the single and whole referent of the clause introduced by this word, wthe utterance of which also finishes the bracket. There is a proposal to expand the attachment of this word to any word spoken in a mekso utterance (rather than only members of selma'o PA), including members of selma'o VUhU, etc.

機能語: connective modifer/limiter
原文: connective modifer/limiter
語法: Used for {ji} and other connective questions.  It is preceded by such a connective (question) word and is followed by the set of words or the selma'o name to which the answer is expected/required to belong; the former may be literally a list of cmavo (such as 'zo .{e} ce zo .{a}', meaning that only AND or AND-OR are acceptable responses) or the name of a set of them (such as 'non-logical connectives', 'tanru after-thought connectives', 'symmetric connectives', 'all connectives except .{u}'. etc.). Terminated by {ge'u'i}. For example 'do djica tu'a loi ckafi ji noi'i lu .enai li'u ce lu na .e li'u ge'u'i loi tcati' asks 'Do you want: some coffee, some tea - where your answer can be only the former or the latter?'.

機能語: 量化型 selbri 変数抽象 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、第3階以上の述語論理で使われる束縛 selbri 変数とする
原文: abstractor: abstractor to create logically quantified selbri variable to be used in predicate logic of third or higher order.
語法: 第1階の述語論理では {zo'e} が定項、 {da} が束縛変項であり、第2階の述語論理では {co'e} が selbri 定数、 {bu'a} が束縛 selbri 変数である。 第3階以上の述語論理を表現するためには、第2階の selbri 全体を対象領域とする selbri が必要である。 NU類に属する {su'u} ・ {bu'ai} はそれぞれ、第2階の selbri 全体を対象領域とする selbri 定数・束縛 selbri 変数を構成することができる。 {bu'ai} が取る selbri 変数が2個以上になる場合は {ju'e} などで繋げる。 {bu'ai} を入れ子状に使えば、さらに高階の述語論理も構成できる。 例： su'o bu'ai xe'u kei su'o bu'a ro da zo'u bu'ai da bu'a （この {xe'u} はNU類を冠頭に置くためのダミー的な {selbrisle}） ・関連語： {su'u}, {bu'a}; {xe'u}.

機能語: 命題抽象 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、その bridi が内包する命題を抽出する； 抽象の焦点となる sumti を ce'u に替えて置ける； bridi の範囲を含めた全体が１つの selbri となる； 冠詞を左に加えると sumti になる； x_1 は x_2 （文字列）によって表される[bridi]（命題）
原文: abstractor: predication/bridi abstractor; x_1 is predication [bridi] expressed in sentence x_2.
語法: ・読み方： ドゥフ  ・関連語： {bridi}

機能語: 真理値抽象 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、その bridi が内包する真理値を抽出する； 抽象の焦点となる sumti を ce'u に替えて置ける； bridi の範囲を含めた全体が１つの selbri となる； 冠詞を左に加えると sumti になる；x_1 は[bridi]の真理値、 x_2 （認識体系）の
原文: abstractor: truth-value abstractor; x_1 is truth value of [bridi] under epistemology x_2.
語法: 「lo jei do mi nelci = あなたが私のことを好きかどうか」 ・大意： 抽象： 真理値 ・読み方： ジェイ

機能語: 性質抽象 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、その bridi が内包する性質を抽出する； 抽象の焦点となる sumti を ce'u に替えて置ける； bridi の範囲を含めた全体が１つの selbri となる； 冠詞を左に加えると sumti になる；x_1 は［bridi］に表される性質
原文: abstractor: property/quality abstractor (-ness); x_1 is quality/property exhibited by [bridi].
語法: 「ka prami／愛（という性質）」「ka prami ce'u／愛されるという性質」「ka ce'u prami／愛するという性質」・大意： 抽象： 性質 ・読み方： カ ・語呂合わせ： 性質か ・関連語： {ckaji}

機能語: abstractor: predicate abstractor. x_1 is the predicate expressed by [bridi], using bo'a, bo'e, etc for variables.
原文: abstractor: predicate abstractor. x_1 is the predicate expressed by [bridi], using bo'a, bo'e, etc for variables.
語法: Identical in meaning to an n-ary {ka}, but with lambda-variables bound to {bo'a}/{bo'e}/{bo'i}/{bo'o}/{bo'u} ({bo'ai} for additional variables) instead of {ce'u} (which may still be used for "next place"). This is mainly for convenience, to avoid having to assign pro-sumti to {ce'u} variables either with {goi} or {ce'ai}. See {me'ei}, {me'au}, {cei'e}, {ckaji}, {ckini}

機能語: abstractor: x_1 (x_2, ...) are such that they satisfy [bridi], using bo'a/bo'e/etc for variables
原文: abstractor: x_1 (x_2, ...) are such that they satisfy [bridi], using bo'a/bo'e/etc for variables
語法: {kai'ei} is to {kai'u} what {ka'ei} is to {ka}. Uses {bo'a}/{bo'e}/{bo'i}/{bo'o}/{bo'u} ({bo'ai} for more variables) instead of {ce'u} (which may still be used for "next place").

機能語: abstractor: x_1 (x_2, ...) are such that they satisfy [bridi], binding to the open {ce'u} slots.
原文: abstractor: x_1 (x_2, ...) are such that they satisfy [bridi], binding to the open {ce'u} slots.
語法: See also {me'au}, {emna}, {ka} and {ce'u}

機能語: 経験抽象 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、その bridi が内包する経験を抽出する； 抽象の焦点となる sumti を ce'u に替えて置ける； bridi の範囲を含めた全体が１つの selbri となる； 冠詞を左に加えると sumti になる；x_1 は［bridi］に表される経験、 x_2 （経験者）の
原文: abstractor: experience abstractor; x_1 is x_2's experience of [bridi] (participant or observer).
語法: ・大意： 抽象： 経験 ・読み方： ルィヒ  ・関連語： {lifri}

機能語: 数量抽象 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、その bridi が内包する数量を抽出する； 抽象の焦点となる sumti を ce'u に替えて置ける； bridi の範囲を含めた全体が１つの selbri となる； 冠詞を左に加えると sumti になる；x_1 は［bridi］に表される数量、 x_2 （尺度）の
原文: abstractor: quantity/amount abstractor; x_1 is quantity/amount of [bridi] measured on scale x_2.
語法: ・大意： 抽象： 数量 ・読み方： ニ  ・関連語： {klani}

機能語: x_1 is a number/value such that the abstraction is true, under mathematical system x_2; x_1 binds to ke'a within the abstraction
原文: x_1 is a number/value such that the abstraction is true, under mathematical system x_2; x_1 binds to ke'a within the abstraction
語法: Essentially a specialized version of {poi'i} for use with predicated mathematical statements (as an alternative to mekso). See also {ke'a}.

機能語: 事象抽象 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、その bridi が内包する事象を抽出する； 抽象の焦点となる sumti を ce'u に替えて置ける； bridi の範囲を含めた全体が１つの selbri となる； 冠詞を左に加えると sumti になる；x_1 は［bridi］に表される事象
原文: abstractor: generalized event abstractor; x_1 is state/process/achievement/activity of [bridi].
語法: NUの中では su'u に次いで抽出対象が最も広い。 過程（pu'u）／時点（mu'e）／動作（zu'o）／状態（za'i）／経験（li'i）も含まれる。 ・大意： 抽象： 事象 ・読み方： ヌ  ・関連語： {fasnu}

機能語: x1 is such that poi'i abstraction is true; x1 binds ke'a within the abstraction.
原文: x1 is such that poi'i abstraction is true; x1 binds ke'a within the abstraction.
語法: Originally proposed by And Rosta around 2001.

機能語: 概念抽象 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、その bridi が内包する概念を抽出する； 抽象の焦点となる sumti を ce'u に替えて置ける； bridi の範囲を含めた全体が１つの selbri となる； 冠詞を左に加えると sumti になる；x_1 は［bridi］に表される概念、 x_2 （思考者）の
原文: abstractor: idea/concept abstractor; x_1 is x_2's concept of [bridi].
語法: ・大意： 抽象： 概念 ・読み方： スィホ  ・関連語： {sidbo}

機能語: 不特定抽象 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、その bridi の不特定の内包要素を抽出する； 抽象の焦点となる sumti を ce'u に替えて置ける； bridi の範囲を含めた全体が１つの selbri となる； 冠詞を左に加えると sumti になる；x_1 は［bridi］に表される不特定の抽象、 x_2 （種類）の
原文: abstractor: generalized abstractor (how); x_1 is [bridi] as a non-specific abstraction of type x_2.
語法: NUの中では抽出対象の範囲が最も広い。・大意： 抽象： 不特定 ・読み方： スフ  ・関連語： {sucta}

機能語: bridi abstractor: x_1 is the answer to the question x_2
原文: bridi abstractor: x_1 is the answer to the question x_2
語法: Experimental cmavo compound. Equivalent to {du'u} with {kau} attached to all question words (e.g. {ma}, {mo}, {xo}) contained. See {preti}, {danfu}, {du'umrei}

機能語: abstractor: experience of being: x_1 is x_2's experience of being [bridi] (property of x_2; with {ce'u} referring to x_2's position)
原文: abstractor: experience of being: x_1 is x_2's experience of being [bridi] (property of x_2; with {ce'u} referring to x_2's position)
語法: = {li'imdu} {be} {lo} {ka}. See {li'i}, {ze'ei}, {li'i ze'ei nu}

原文: abstractor: experience of event: x_1 is x_2's experience of observing or participating in [bridi] (event)
語法: = {li'imdu} {be} {lo} {nu}. See {li'i}, {ze'ei}, {li'i ze'ei ka}

語法: ・読み方： セドゥフ

語法: = {lo} {sidbo} {be} {lo} {du'u}. See {si'o}, {ze'ei}, {kau}

機能語: 動作 ： 抽象詞； bridi の左に付いて、その bridi が内包する動作を抽出する； 抽象の焦点となる sumti を ce'u に替えて置ける； bridi の範囲を含めた全体が１つの selbri となる； 冠詞を左に加えると sumti になる；x_1 は［bridi］に表される動作、 x_2 （要素）の
原文: abstractor: activity (event) abstractor; x_1 is abstract activity of [bridi] composed of x_2.
語法: 蟻の手洗いも銀河の運行も。「lo zu'o citka」で「食べる動き」「食事作法」など。 ・大意： 抽象： 動作 ・読み方： ズホ  ・関連語： {zukte}

原文: start forethought termset construct; marks start of place structure set with logical connection.
語法: 「klama nu'i ge lo zarci (x_2) lo briju (x_3) nu'u gi lo zdani (x_2) lo ckule (x_3) [nu'u]／店(x_2)から会社(x_3)に行き、家(x_2)から学校(x_3)に行く」 ・読み方： ヌヒ ・関連語： {ce'e}; {nu'u}

語法: ・読み方： ヌフ

機能語: digit/number: least contextually-possible number
原文: digit/number: least contextually-possible number

機能語: digit/number: any number
原文: digit/number: any number
語法: Not more than all; idiom to indicate that any number (within contextual limits, i.e. {rone'e} {bi'i} {ro}) would satisfy the predicate. {su'o}{no} "at least zero" is also usable in contexts where negative numbers aren't meaningful (e.g. most quantifiers). See {xe'e}, {xo'e}

機能語: digit/number: specific referent; modifies quantifier to indicate that there are particular referents that fulfill the predicate

語法: ({xe'e} pa prenu) = "any one person / one non-specific person", (xe'enai pa prenu) = "one specific person". See {itca}, {steci}, {su'anai}

機能語: digit/number: absolute zero; nothing; there does not exist; ∄
原文: digit/number: absolute zero; nothing; there does not exist; ∄
語法: Mathematically equivalent to {no}, but implies lack of negative values, especially on a scale ({va'e}/{va'ei} e.g.). Equivalent to "{rone'e} {no}". Cf. {no'e'u}, {su'o}, {ro}, {su'oi}, {ro'oi}

機能語: digit/number: liminal zero; neither positive nor negative
原文: digit/number: liminal zero; neither positive nor negative

原文: digit/number: precise to within the stated sigfigs (significant figures/digits); approximately, measured to be approximately, with some error/rounding
語法: In the {su'e} and {su'o} family. See also: {su'au}.

機能語: digit/number: exact, exactly equal to, no more and no less, mathematically ideally (no measuring or rounding error)
原文: digit/number: exact, exactly equal to, no more and no less, mathematically ideally (no measuring or rounding error)
語法: In the {su'e} and {su'o} family. In some sense, it is equivalent to {su'e} {je} {su'o}; in some sense, it emphasizes the exact equality; but it also can distinguish results from data/measurements and mathematical truths. See also: {su'ai}.

機能語: 最大で～／多くとも～ ： 数量詞；

原文: existential plural quantifier. ``There is/are.''
語法: ``{su'oi} {da}'' = ``{na} {ku} {ro'oi} {da} {na} {ku}.'' cf. {su'o} は ∃ を表す単数量化子

機能語: digit/number: any/non-specific referent; modifies quantifier to indicate that it is not important what the specific members of the referential set are
原文: digit/number: any/non-specific referent; modifies quantifier to indicate that it is not important what the specific members of the referential set are
語法: Note: {ro} is preferred if you are merely saying that the predicate is true for all referents ("Anyone can do this"), rather than saying something like "Choose any two apples". // (xe'e pa prenu) = "any one person / one non-specific person", ({xe'enai} pa prenu) = "one specific person". See {itca}, {steci}, {su'anai}, {su'ero}, {te'i'o}

機能語: digit/number: Euler–Mascheroni constant, usually denoted by lowercase gamma (γ); approximately 0.5772156649 (in decimal).
原文: digit/number: Euler–Mascheroni constant, usually denoted by lowercase gamma (γ); approximately 0.5772156649 (in decimal).
語法: The difference in the limit as n becomes arbitrarily large between/of: the sum of (1/k) for all strictly positive integers k < (n+1), and the natural logarithm of n.

機能語: imaginary i (non-comma)
原文: imaginary i (non-comma)
語法: This is literally a unit, a pure number that is treated as a scalar; it is what happens when considering C to be a field over C - ordered pairs/tuples for coordinates no longer make much sense. Thus, this number operates exactly as one might think i would/should operate: as a single number, without components. In certain bases, it can be used a pure digit (which simplifies some potential numeric strings, compared to the usage of {ka'o} therein). See also: {ka'o}

機能語: generic algebra unit e_n
原文: generic algebra unit e_n
語法: The structure/space in which it is being considered should be specified.  Subscripts are expected. Used for octonions, sedenions, etc. Can also be used for R, C, or H. Works like {ka'o} (as a comma) and is isomorphic to it. See also: {ka'o}, {kai'o}, {kei'o}, {koi'o}.

機能語: quaternion j
原文: quaternion j
語法: Works like {ka'o} (as a comma) and is isomorphic to it. See also: {ka'o}, {kai'o}, {koi'o}, {kau'o}.

機能語: quaternion k
原文: quaternion k

機能語: digit/number: Meissel-Mertens constant M ≈ 0.2614972128476427837554268386086958590516…
原文: digit/number: Meissel-Mertens constant M ≈ 0.2614972128476427837554268386086958590516…
語法: The limiting difference of the harmonic series summed over only the positive prime natural numbers less than or equal to n and the natural logarithm of the natural logarithm of n, as n -> ∞.

原文: digit/number: Hafner-Sarnak-McCurley coprime determinants limiting probability constant; h ≈ 0.3532363719…
語法: The limiting probability of two n×n matrices have determinants that are coprime, as n ->  ∞

機能語: digit/number: Niven's greatest-exponent prime factorization constant  lim_(n->∞) (avg_n (H)) ≈ 1.705211…
原文: digit/number: Niven's greatest-exponent prime factorization constant  lim_(n->∞) (avg_n (H)) ≈ 1.705211…
語法: This constant is the greatest exponent appearing in the prime factorization of a positive natural number over the ring integers on average. See also: {ni'e'oi}

機能語: digit/number: Niven's smallest-exponent prime factorization constant c = zeta(3/2)/zeta(3) ≈ 2.1732543125195541382370898404…
原文: digit/number: Niven's smallest-exponent prime factorization constant c = zeta(3/2)/zeta(3) ≈ 2.1732543125195541382370898404…
語法: This constant plays a role in the bounding of the infinite sum of the smallest exponents in the prime factorizations of the positive natural numbers over the ring of integers; specifically, it is the coefficient of the √(n) term; Niven's bound more fully is given by n + c√(n)  +  o(√(n)). See also: {ni'e'ei}

機能語: mekso style converter: elementwise application of operator
原文: mekso style converter: elementwise application of operator
語法: Prefixed to an operator/function that operates on numbers, thereby transforming it to a set operator (thus its arguments must be sets where before they were numbers), as defined in a given structure. Produces the set of all numbers that are given by some ordered pair of elements (the nth term of which belongs to the nth set specified) with the operator acting on them (per the rules of that operator). The set produced may include empty terms and/or infinity. Let "✦" represent the operator; then X_1 kei'ai ✦ X_2 boi X_3 boi X_4 = Set(x_1✦x_2✦x_3✦x_4: x_i in X_i). See also {kei'au} for a similar but different word.

語法: Outputs the terbri in the standard/original/trivial order: x1 broda x2 x3 x4 x5. Useful for answering '{se'u'o}' questions.

機能語: x_1-x_2 転換 ： selbri の左に付いてPSの x_1 と x_2 を転換する
原文: 2nd conversion; switch 1st/2nd places.
語法: ・大意： x_1-x_2 転換 ・読み方： セ

機能語: elliptical/generic/unspecific/vague selbri conversion
原文: elliptical/generic/unspecific/vague selbri conversion
語法: Basically says 'in some (id est: at least one) ordering/permutation, these arguments and this selbri make sense [and I claim the produced sentence]'. The ordering may be complicated, or it could even be the case that multiple orderings work.  Can be useful for when one does not quite remember or care about the exact definition of a brivla, including in sumti; can also be useful when the conversion is particularly complicated, when a desired terbri has a large index, or when multiple conversions are true; it is an allowed, if unhelpful, response to {se'u'o}.

機能語: selbri conversion question
原文: selbri conversion question
語法: Asks for the SE word that is intended (or at least makes the sentence true). Subscript a set of numbers that represent the order of terbri in question; the subscripted set can be a set of ordered or unordered tuples, specifying exactly which terbri may be exchanged. 'la .ralf. se'u'o xi li re ce li ci pi'u li re cebo li ci klama by boi cy' = 'Did Ralph come to B from C or to C from B?' (notably, 'Did B come to Ralph from C?' is not a possible option for answering the question). An answer is a SE string that is allowed by the selbri and by the subscripts; continuing the example, if the response is 'Ralph went to C from B', one would respond with '.i {setese}'.  Any SE word works for the general question possibility (which is the unrestricted/non-subscripted case). Essentially 'se'u'o xi sy' is equivalent to 'se xi li xo poi ke'a cmima sy' (where '{te}' is basically understood as ' se xi li jo'i pa boi ci te'u ', etc.), but the answer can be a complicated ordered sequence/string of SE words; this word complements specifically {fi'a} in the typical/same way that SE complements FA. Typically, leaving the subscripted set vague or not completely free of every possible semantic or syntactic pathology is perfectly fine; syntax and practicality will typically restrict it enough for reasonable responses to be made. See also: {re'au'e} (which alone would be used in answering that 'Ralph goes to B from C' in the previous question).

(Use {bo'ai} for more places if needed, or {ce'u} for "next place"). // {cei'e} is meant to be used to define new words (implicit {ca'e}) but may be modified by evidentials to express an assertion ({ju'a}) or opinion ({pe'i}) on a meaning instead. Alternatively, {smuni} and {ka'ei} may be used. // See {cei}, {goi}, {goi'e}

機能語: terbri editor: passes the terbri value through the quoted function so that the sumti that fills it really is filling the output of the function
原文: terbri editor: passes the terbri value through the quoted function so that the sumti that fills it really is filling the output of the function
語法: Terminated by itself ({sei'au}); explicit termination is always required; the sumti after it must be explicit (even if elliptical, such as with explicit use of {zo'e}). Inside the module formed by the "sei'au" brackets, at most three sumti (where this counting contracts connected sumti into one) can be specified. The first one is a {mau'au}-{zai'ai} quoted function (which is taken to be the operand of this word); it must be preceded (not necessarily immediately) by {li}; let f be this function. The second and third sumti each are a nonnegative integer (preceded by {li}); call them n and m respectively; n defaults to 1 and m defaults to the next (thus-far unfilled) terbri number for/of the current selbri unless these specifications are overridden by zmico; if the relevant selbri has no terbri following this word, then this default value of m causes this word to have no effect. The mth terbri of the selbri to which this construct applies will be passed through f before being filled by any sumti (including {zo'e}, explicit or implicit; terbri numbers start counting at 1 and increase by 1 with each new occurrence) for the next n occurrences of the aforementioned selbri in the discourse (with n = 1 counting the current occurrence; aside: a non-default value of m can thus affect the interpretation of an already-filled terbri of the currently open selbri in an afterthought manner); this counting is only done forward in the discourse/time, including the current selbri, never back through it. Thus, n = 0 effectively neutralizes this word, n being infinite causes the effect to be permanent. f being {zi'a'o} returns the terbri in question to its default value/understanding (according to zmico). It is important to realize that this word does not affect the mth terbri of all selbri, just of the one currently open when this word is utterred (no matter where it is positioned/nested in future costructs). If this word is in conflict with another usage of this word over the same terbri, follow the specification applied by the most recent still active occurrence of this construct; this construct is considered to be active for this purpose until its-n occurrences of the appropriate terbri are uttered; thus if the earlier-n is greater than the later-n, the later effect takes precedent until it is disactivated, after which point the earlier effect resumes. Define n and  m (and f) outside of the module created by brackets of this word if you wish to reuse them; for the sake of future referencing the value specified within the module, n gets reduced/decremented by 1 at each occurrence of the appropriate terbri until it reaches the value 0 (at which value it remains forever after); if n is a series of connected numbers, this decrementation is applied to each connectand in turn. Use {pi'u} (possibly subscripted) in order to simplify utterances. Especially helpful if f is non-injective. The affected terbri must be referenced by {ce'u} as an operand of f wheresoever it is desired; this reference must be explicit.  Let 'broda' be the currentry open selbri; then this word replaces broda_m with f(broda_m) in the definition of 'broda' for the next n occurrences of the terbri. For example, if f were {cu'a}, then any sumti which fills broda_m will be understood to be doing so in absolute value.  See also: {de'ai}.

機能語: 相互 sumti ： お互いに； 右に連なる sumti 間の相互関係を表す
原文: discursive: reciprocal sumti marker; indicates a reciprocal relationship between sumti.
語法: 連なる sumti のうち、 soi の直前に来る sumti を表しているものは省略できる（mi prami do soi vo'a vo'e → mi prami do soi vo'a）； 終端子は {se'u}。 「soi SUMTI SUMTI se'u」 という構文で、文中のどこにでも置ける挿入句を構成する。この性質から、 「soi xi re li pai li te'o mi klama le zarci」 のような意味不明の文が、文法上は作成可能である。 また、単なる挿入句であるため、文法上は terbri を構成する sumti の順番に影響を与えず、「2つの sumti を交換しても文が成り立つ」という本来の意図を構文に反映させることができない。 このように構造上の問題点が多いため、この定義による soi の使用を止めている話者が多い。 ・読み方： ソイ ・関連語： {simxu}

機能語: attitudinal scope modifier: marks following attitudinal/UI-cluster as applying to the last lexical unit
原文: attitudinal scope modifier: marks following attitudinal/UI-cluster as applying to the last lexical unit
語法: Part of a proposal to redefine attitudinals/UI-clauses as being inherently ambiguous in scope; placing ji'au before the UI-clause (e.g. ji'au ui) will restore and emphasize the original functionality of UI-clauses attaching to the last lexical unit. See {i'au}, {toi'e}, {fu'e}, {fu'o}. Closable with {toi'o}.

機能語: UI-cmavo parenthesis/separator: start grouping
原文: UI-cmavo parenthesis/separator: start grouping
語法: This word is intended to "separate" cmavo in a UI-clause; it can separate the UI-cmavo a {toi'e} parenthetical will attach to. For example, in (iuro'o toi'e uinai), (uinai) would attach to (iuro'o), while in (iu koi'e ro'o toi'e uinai), (uinai) would attach only to (ro'o). /It can also override the normal "priority order" of how attitudinal-modifiers like {ro'a} and {dai} affect each other; this order is currently ill-defined, however. /Elidable terminator: {toi'o}

機能語: start UI-applicative metalinguistic UI-parenthetical
原文: start UI-applicative metalinguistic UI-parenthetical
語法: Presently (without this word), there is no "official" way to apply a UI cmavo to another (instead, they merely express simultaneous emotions pertaining to the relevant construct). This word begins a parenthetical which can contain UI cmavo and applies these cmavo as a string of UI to the immediately previous UI cmavo metalinguistically (as if the external UI is/are any other type of word which can be acted upon by UI). An omitted UI (external or internal) in this case is equivalent to {ge'e}. Since the produced parenthetical functions as UI, nested or subsequent such parentheticals operate on it as it operates on external UI cmavo. For details on grouping and application, see {koi'e}. See also: {toi'o}.

機能語: end UI-applicative metalinguistic UI-parenthetical (elidable terminator)
原文: end UI-applicative metalinguistic UI-parenthetical (elidable terminator)
語法: Terminates {toi'e} parenthetical. Inherently functions as {fu'o} (only if abstraction-level and otherwise appropriately accessed) on any internal UI cmavo, with the added functionality of metalinguistic application. See also: {toi'e}.

原文: discursive: marks an utterance as using something that is experimental/not official, especially experimental grammar
語法: In some sense, functions as an error marker or an error quote (but without the quote).

原文: discursive: indicate a change in speaker; used generally in quotations.
語法: Considered to have {sa'a} attached to it by default. Using {sa'anai} would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

機能語: translation marker - original/native version: marks a construct as having been translated and therefore particularly (possibly, but not necessarily) susceptible to the errors or limitations associated with translation (especially if the translator is unsure of the best result/option)
原文: translation marker - original/native version: marks a construct as having been translated and therefore particularly (possibly, but not necessarily) susceptible to the errors or limitations associated with translation (especially if the translator is unsure of the best result/option)
語法: Might be useful for translations of idioms, songs, poetry, wordplay, political speeches, nuanced phrasings, (in stories) prophecies, riddles, rhymes, etc. Followed by members of selma'o CAI, the marker indicates the corresponding level of uncertainty in the best possible choice of translation according to the opinion/expectation/judgment of the speaker/translator. Also may indicate a cultural or linguistic gap. For Lojban especially, it might be useful when various ambiguities arise in the original text and the translator is forced to pick interpretations from among them.

機能語: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'a; used generally in quotations.
原文: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'a; used generally in quotations.
語法: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.
